NASA STEM Partnerships: Bridging NASA Mi.title: NASA STEM Partnerships: Bridging NASA Missions With Classroom Instruction
NASA STEM Partnerships: Bridging NASA Mi.desc: NASA missions are out of this world, literally. When new missions and scientific discoveries from these missions emerge, there are several ways they are employed here on Earth.

Teams 3D Print Planetary Habitats, Award.title: Teams 3D Print Planetary Habitats, Awarded $700K in NASA Challenge
Teams 3D Print Planetary Habitats, Award.desc: After 30 hours of 3D printing over four days of head-to-head competition, NASA and partner Bradley University of Peoria, Illinois, have awarded $700,000 to two teams in the final round of the 3D-Printed Habitat Challenge.

NASA Invites Media to Attend 'NASA Day i.title: NASA Invites Media to Attend 'NASA Day in Baton Rouge' Activities May 8
NASA Invites Media to Attend 'NASA Day i.desc: NASA's Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama, and Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans invite media to attend NASA Day in Baton Rouge activities May 8 at Southern University Laboratory School located at 129 Swan St., Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

NASA Announces University Student Design.title: NASA Announces University Student Design Challenge Winners
NASA Announces University Student Design.desc: NASA’s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland has chosen scholars from The University of Akron, Akron, Ohio and Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University (Virginia Tech), Blacksburg, Virginia, as first and second place winners of the 2018-2019 University Student Design Challenge.

NASA Brings Moon and More to Visitors at.title: NASA Brings Moon and More to Visitors at COSI Science Festival
NASA Brings Moon and More to Visitors at.desc: NASA will host a range of activities and demonstrations, including a virtual reality chair and Oculus Go trip to the Moon, at the COSI Science Festival Wednesday, May 1, through Saturday, May 4, in Columbus, Ohio.

NASA Celebrates Earth Day with Social Me.title: NASA Celebrates Earth Day with Social Media, Public Events
NASA Celebrates Earth Day with Social Me.desc: This Earth Day, April 22, NASA invites you to celebrate our beautiful home planet by participating in a global social media event and local events around the country.

NASA Hosts University Students to Discus.title: NASA Hosts University Students to Discuss Future of Space Exploration
NASA Hosts University Students to Discus.desc: NASA is giving university students an opportunity to interact with agency leadership, including NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine, as well as astronauts abroad the International Space Station, during a live event 2 p.m. EDT Monday, April 29, at the agency’s headquarters in Washington.

NASA Astronaut, Researchers Visit Austin.title: NASA Astronaut, Researchers Visit Austin to Highlight International Space Station
NASA Astronaut, Researchers Visit Austin.desc: Astronaut Stephanie Wilson, along with representatives from NASA and the U.S. International Space Station (ISS) National Lab, will visit Austin from April 23 to 25 as part of NASA’s efforts to share research opportunities aboard the station.

NASA Announces Winners of 25th Annual Ro.title: NASA Announces Winners of 25th Annual Rover Challenge
NASA Announces Winners of 25th Annual Ro.desc: NASA has announced the winners of the 2019 Human Exploration Rover Challenge, held April 12-13 at the U.S. Space & Rocket Center in Huntsville, Alabama.

NASA to Host 2019 Rover Challenge; Veter.title: NASA to Host 2019 Rover Challenge; Veteran Astronaut Sunita Williams to Attend
NASA to Host 2019 Rover Challenge; Veter.desc: Nearly 100 high school and college teams will compete April 12-13 in the NASA Human Exploration Rover Challenge at the U.S. Space & Rocket Center. Members of the Huntsville-area media are invited to cover the event, planned and hosted annually by NASA’s Marshall Center.

NASA to Land in Mars, Pennsylvania to Ce.title: NASA to Land in Mars, Pennsylvania to Celebrate Red Planet with STEAM
NASA to Land in Mars, Pennsylvania to Ce.desc: NASA returns to Mars, Pennsylvania Friday, May 31 to celebrate Mars exploration and share the agency’s excitement about landing astronauts on the Moon in five years.

Virginia\u2019s Phoebus High School Wins.title: Virginia’s Phoebus High School Wins NASA HUNCH Culinary Challenge for Second Time
Virginia\u2019s Phoebus High School Wins.desc: NASA’s Johnson Space Center Food Lab in Houston will process the entrée and send it up to the International Space Station for astronauts to enjoy.

NASA Invites Public to Submit Names to F.title: NASA Invites Public to Submit Names to Fly Aboard Next Mars Rover
NASA Invites Public to Submit Names to F.desc: Although it will be years before the first humans set foot on Mars, NASA is giving the public an opportunity to send their names — etched on microchips — to the Red Planet with NASA's Mars 2020 rover, which represents the initial leg of humanity’s first round trip to another planet.

NASA Administrator to Speak at Florida I.title: NASA Administrator to Speak at Florida Institute of Technology Event
NASA Administrator to Speak at Florida I.desc: NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine will deliver remarks and speak to media Thursday, May 23, at Florida Institute of Technology in Melbourne.

NASA Awards Cooperative Agreements for R.title: NASA Awards Cooperative Agreements for Research and Development Programs
NASA Awards Cooperative Agreements for R.desc: NASA Awards Cooperative Agreements for Research and Development Programs

Kansas Students to Speak with NASA Astro.title: Kansas Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
Kansas Students to Speak with NASA Astro.desc: Students from Kansas will have an opportunity this week to speak with a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station who also hails from the Sunflower State.

University Teams Practice Drilling for W.title: University Teams Practice Drilling for Water on the Moon and Mars
University Teams Practice Drilling for W.desc: University Teams Practice Drilling for Water on the Moon and Mars

NASA Administrator to Talk Moon Landing.title: NASA Administrator to Talk Moon Landing Anniversary, Moon to Mars Plans
NASA Administrator to Talk Moon Landing.desc: Just days before the 50th anniversary of one of humanity’s greatest achievements – astronauts first walking on the Moon – NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine will host a media teleconference at 1 p.m. EDT on Monday, July 15.

New York City Students to Speak with NAS.title: New York City Students to Speak with NASA Astronauts on Space Station
New York City Students to Speak with NAS.desc: Students in New York City will have an opportunity next week to talk with NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

NASA Celebrates 50th Anniversary of Hist.title: NASA Celebrates 50th Anniversary of Historic Moon Landing with Live TV Broadcast, Events
NASA Celebrates 50th Anniversary of Hist.desc: NASA will celebrate the 50th anniversary of the historic Apollo 11 Moon mission and look to the future of exploration on the Moon and Mars with a live, two-hour television broadcast Friday, July 19, and partner-led events taking place across the country from July 16 through July 20.

NASA Invites Media to Renaming Ceremony.title: NASA Invites Media to Renaming Ceremony Honoring Hidden Figures
NASA Invites Media to Renaming Ceremony.desc: NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine will be joined at 10 a.m. EDT Wednesday, June 12, by U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz of Texas, D.C. Council Chairman Phil Mendelson, and author Margot Lee Shetterly for the renaming of the street in front of NASA Headquarters in Washington – E Street SW – to “Hidden Figures Way.”

Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astron.title: Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astron.desc: Students from Maine will have an opportunity next week to talk live with a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station.

NASA Administrator Invites Public to Upd.title: NASA Administrator Invites Public to Update on Agency’s Return to Moon
NASA Administrator Invites Public to Upd.desc: The public is invited to join NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine at 9:40 a.m. EDT Friday, Oct. 25, for an update on the agency’s Artemis program and the critical role international partnerships have in returning astronauts to the Moon and going on to Mars.

Maryland, Washington Students to Speak w.title: Maryland, Washington Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
Maryland, Washington Students to Speak w.desc: Students from Maryland and Washington, D.C., will have an opportunity this week to talk with a NASA astronaut currently living and working aboard the International Space Station.

IAC 2019: Where NASA STEM, Young Profess.title: IAC 2019: Where NASA STEM, Young Professionals, Students and YOU Fit In
IAC 2019: Where NASA STEM, Young Profess.desc: The International Astronautical Congree welcomes students from all over the world, granting them opportunities to present research, gain new insight and ideas, and network with space policy professionals from around the globe.

NASA to Provide Coverage of Key Events a.title: NASA to Provide Coverage of Key Events at 70th International Astronautical Congress
NASA to Provide Coverage of Key Events a.desc: NASA will provide live coverage on NASA Television of key events at the 70th International Astronautical Congress (IAC), which takes place Oct. 21-25 at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center in Washington.

In-Space News Conference to Review First.title: In-Space News Conference to Review First All-Woman Spacewalk
In-Space News Conference to Review First.desc: NASA astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir will participate in a news conference from orbit at noon EDT, Monday, Oct. 21, following their Friday spacewalk – the first to be conducted by two women.

Women in STEM: Reflecting on the Past, P.title: Women in STEM: Reflecting on the Past, Present and Future
Women in STEM: Reflecting on the Past, P.desc: Women in STEM: Reflecting on the Past, Present and Future

NASA to Televise First All-Female Spacew.title: NASA to Televise First All-Female Spacewalk, Host Media Teleconference
NASA to Televise First All-Female Spacew.desc: On the first ever all-female spacewalk, NASA astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir will venture outside the International Space Station about 7:50 a.m. EDT Friday, Oct. 18, to replace faulty equipment on the station’s exterior. Live coverage will begin at 6:30 a.m. on NASA Television and the agency’s website.

NASA Announces Changes to Spacewalk Sche.title: NASA Announces Changes to Spacewalk Schedule, First All-Female Spacewalk
NASA Announces Changes to Spacewalk Sche.desc: NASA is hosting a media teleconference at 4:30 p.m. EDT today to discuss this week’s first all-female spacewalk at the International Space Station. Audio of the teleconference will stream live on the agency’s website.

NASA Invites Media to Events Highlightin.title: NASA Invites Media to Events Highlighting Spacesuits for Moon to Mars
NASA Invites Media to Events Highlightin.desc: Media are invited to NASA Headquarters in Washington Tuesday, Oct. 15 to get an up-close look at the next generation spacesuits the first woman and next man to explore the Moon will wear as part of the agency’s Artemis program.

NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institutio.title: NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institutions to Advance Aerospace Manufacturing
NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institutio.desc: The Minority University Research and Education Project (MUREP) of NASA’s Office of STEM Engagement is partnering with the agency’s Aeronautics Research Mission Directorate to provide students at minority-serving institutions the education and experience needed to help address manufacturing needs in the U.S. aerospace sector.

NASA Deputy Administrator, Astronaut Can.title: NASA Deputy Administrator, Astronaut Candidate to Visit University of North Carolina
NASA Deputy Administrator, Astronaut Can.desc: NASA Deputy Administrator Jim Morhard and astronaut candidate Zena Cardman will visit the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (UNC-Chapel Hill) Wednesday to Thursday, Nov. 6-7, to discuss the agency’s Artemis program.

Interns Express Themselves Through NASA.title: Interns Express Themselves Through NASA Projects
Interns Express Themselves Through NASA.desc: Interns Express Themselves Through NASA Projects

NASA, University of Alabama to Collabora.title: NASA, University of Alabama to Collaborate on Advanced, In-space Manufacturing
NASA, University of Alabama to Collabora.desc: NASA’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama, is expanding its partnership with the University of Alabama in Tuscaloosa, to collaborate on advanced and in-space manufacturing.
